Selectors¶

The Selectors API is for convient element selection relative to the current element (the context). This is done by replacing spcific keyword described below.

This API is not only used for selecting elements, it can also be used to generate names for Variables (see Trigger) and similiar purposes.

If a plugin uses this API to generate selectors, they should always use jQuery selectors.

Keywords¶

{this}

Can be placed everywhere in the selector an will be replaced by the id of the current (context) element.

{parent-x}

Can be placed everywhere in the selector an will be replaced by the id of the parent number x. {parent-1} will be the first parent, {parent-2} will be the element two levels higher.

{attr-x}

Can be placed everywhere in the selector an will be replaced by the contents of the attribute of the current element. For example, it allows to put the target element in the attribute data-target by using {attr-data-target} as the target expression.

JavaScript¶

Selectors.generate(selector, context)¶
Arguments:
  • selector (string) – A selector expression.
  • context (Element) – The DOM Element the expression refers to.
Returns:

A selector string that can be passed to jQuery.
